## Solution - Problem 5.12

![](images/184.png)
Recall the definition of deflection:

$$\delta = P*L/(A*E)$$

The resultant force in each section must be found first. Working from the leftmost bar to the rightmost:

$$R_1 = -F_1+F_2$$
$$R_2 = F_2$$
$$R_3 = 0 kN$$ 
*Due to no force on right end

Defining other known traits:

$$E_1 = 70 GPa$$
$$E_2 = 210 GPa$$
$$E_3 = 70 GPa$$

Solving for areas:

$$A = \pi*r^2$$
$$A_1 = \pi*(0.25 m)^2$$
$$A_1 = 0.196 m^2$$
$$A_2 = \pi*(0.15 m)^2$$
$$A_2 = 0.071 m^2$$
$$A_3 = \pi*(0.2 m)^2$$
$$A_3 = 0.126 m^2$$
Now finding the deflection for each cylinder:

$$\delta_1 = R_1*L_1/(A_1*E_1)$$
$$\delta_1 = (-F_1+F_2)*L_1/(0.196 m^2*70*10^9 Pa)$$
$$\delta_1 = (-F_1+F_2)*L_1/(1.372*10^{10} N)$$
$$\delta_2 = F_2*L_2/(0.071 m^2*210*10^9 Pa)$$
$$\delta_2 = F_2*L_2/(1.491*10^{10} N)$$
$$\delta_3 = 0*L_3/(0.126 m^2*70*10^9 Pa)$$
$$\delta_3 = 0 m$$

To find total deflection of the system:

$$\delta_T = \delta_1+\delta_2+\delta_3$$
$$solution = (-F_1+F_2)*L_1/(1.372*10^{10} N)+F_2*L_2/(1.491*10^{10} N)$$
